And if Johnny wins, will Amber Heard et al be sought for perjury in the UK? That's something to consider, since she's being investigated for Perjury in Australia.

How much time could Heard face if she's found guilty of Perjury in the UK? Anybody know?

I hope to see you all at the watch party. It's early but it will be well worth it. Here's the link. See you at 4am central! 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BegT76_0Spo

title: UK trial verdict date
description:
Hang onto you hats, kids. We have a date for the verdict in the UK libel trial, thanks to Nick Wallis, who says:

"The judgment in Depp v News Group Newspapers Ltd will be handed down remotely at 10am on Monday 2 November 2020. The judgment will be available on the Judiciary website at 10am, along with a press summary. Nothing will be taking place physically at the Royal Courts of Justice."

That means that nobody has to appear in London for the verdict. That's good, considering the interruptions Johnny's already got to face during filming. If you recall, Amber Heard successfully demanded that Johnny Appear in Virginia to sit for a three day deposition - which he could just as easily have done via video.

You can keep up to date on the UK court website HERE.

Thanks to Nick Wallis for all his tireless efforts keeping us informed.

SOURCE

title: Judge throws Depp's lawyer off the case
description:
Judge Bruce White threw Depp’s attorney Adam Waldman off the case on Friday, after hearing that the attorney had leaked confidential information. Waldman was admitted pro hac vice — for this case only — to Fairfax County Circuit Court in September 2019. That means the Waldman, who practices in Washington, was given permission to represent Johnny in Virginia.

That same month, Judge White signed a protective order governing the treatment of Depp and Heard’s personal information — passport numbers, phone numbers and the like, as well as medical records, including psychological conditions, diagnoses or treatment. 

Heard had moved for sanctions against the Washington attorney last month, contending that the press leaks happened “on at least two occasions.”

She said Waldman was responsible for disseminating audio recordings, surveillance pictures and declarations from third-party witnesses to websites and Twitter users.

In court on Friday, Heard’s lawyers accused Waldman of spreading false rumors about their client.  

White, who is chief judge of the 19th Circuit, agreed Friday to revoke Waldman’s pro hac vice status. Despite finding that ethical standards were violated, the judge declined to issue a gag order against Waldman.  

While it’s easy to see this as a defeat, it’s not. Not at all. Johnny has be represented by Virginia lawyer Benjamin Chew throughout these proceedings thus far, and he’ll continue to do a fine job. After all, whoever presents them, the facts are still the facts, and Amber Heard is still sunk by them. She can’t get everybody fired.

Besides, now that Adam Waldman isn’t constrained by the orders of the case anymore, he can say and do whatever he wants. The judge didn’t issue a gag order remember, and Waldman knows EVERYTHING about the case. While I’m sure he wouldn’t do anything to hurt Johnny – he’s still Johnny’s lawyer – he’s now free to talk about any little thing.

Heard may see this as a victory, but the truth is that she may have shot herself in the food on this one. Waldman’s free to talk, now, and I for one can’t wait to see what he’s got to say.

SOURCE

title: Depp v Heard on YouTube
description:
Before the other day, the most videos I’ve seen on YouTube are the incredibly informative videos done by Incredibly Average, That Brian Fella. He’s got a talent for dissecting the events and information and presenting us with an unbiassed view of the truth.

Aside from Incredibly average, I had seen one or two videos by eHacker, because they did one on the petition. Come to find out, they've got a lot to say on the subject of Heard V Depp.

At that time, though, I wasn’t aware that there were YouTubers that were doing live streams chatting about the events surrounding Johnny Depp versus Amber Heard.

Then I was invited to be a guest on a live chat with Stevie J Raw. At first I declined, because I really didn’t think I was important enough to have anything relevant to say. But then I was reminded that it would help raise awareness for the petition, which raises awareness for not only Johnny Depp, but also other male victims of domestic abuse. So I agreed and I went on Stevie’s live stream.

I think I was an idiot, but Stevie was an extremely gracious host, and everybody was so supportive. They made it painless. HERE’s the link to that video, if you want to see for yourself that I’m not a bot, curls and all.

In the days since, I’ve become aware of more YouTubers who dedicate time to covering the Depp v Heard debacle. They’re sharp, clever, and do a fantastic job of peeling back the layers of the truth. So please give them a look and listen.

In no particular order:
Come Geek Some
Shelby Soup
Truthy McGoo
Spiritually Empowered Coaching
Johnny Depp Project
That Umbrella Guy
Lost Beyond Pluto
Live Abuse Free
Autumn on Venus
Yellow Flash
Believing Bruce
Observe
Nerdette’s Newsstand
Paralegal reacts/Debbi Dooms

They're a talented, knowledgeable group of people, including lawyers. And, as you can see, there’s a lot of discussion going on about the legal proceedings between Johnny Depp and Amber Heard. So join in, or just give a listen. There’s so much more going on than meets the eye.

title: Amber Heard's fate has gone to the dogs
description:
The Department of Agriculture in Queensland, Australia is investigating Amber Heard for possible perjury over the Pistol & Boo star-paws palaver. Hound lovers may recall that during the Pirates of the Caribbean star’s libel case against The Sun newspaper, Depp’s former employee told the court he was forced to lie under oath about the dogs’ illegal entry into Queensland. Heard’s former assistant also claimed the actor “deliberately smuggled the dogs into Australia.”

The 34-year-old Heard avoided conviction in April 2016 after she pleaded guilty to giving Customs a false document. But she and Depp were forced to film a hostage video, sorry, biosecurity apology. 

The department is investigating if any criminal offences under commonwealth legislation have been committed relating to the testimony provided to the High Court in London. As the matter is the subject of a current investigation the department is unable to provide any further comment at this time.

The maximum penalty for perjury in Queensland? Fourteen years in jail. “Is the defense for perjury that you have got to be able to act?” Joyce zinged. “What is the point of having laws if they are not pursued?”

That’s right, folks. Heard could face up to 14 years in jail for one count of perjury alone.

That doesn’t even begin to touch the time she could serve if Johnny filed a complaint about his finger and had her thrown in jail for assault resulting in grievous bodily injury. If he did that, we wouldn’t have to be bothered with Miss Thang for quite a while.

I don’t know why Johnny hasn’t filed a complaint yet for that finger incident, but I wish he would, and make her face justice for it, once and for all.

What do you think? Should Johnny put Heard in jail for cutting off his finger? Or should he let sleeping dogs lie?

SOURCE

title: Celebs speak out for Johnny Depp
description:
It wasn't very long ago that Snoop Dogg showed Johnny some love on Instagram. 

And now, a couple others are stepping forward.

Singer Sia took to Twitter to say "Just showing my support for Johnny Depp. I mean, I’d love him to get clean and stop with the jewelry, but he is clearly the victim after hearing those tapes."

The 44-year-old singer (born Sia Kate Isobelle Furle) took to Twitter on Thursday, showing her support for the 57-year-old Pirates of the Caribbean star.

She also took a shot towards his ex Amber Heard, and her former boyfriend Elon Musk, throwing some serious shade in another tweet.

"Also @elonmusk didn't you give her the seven million she "donated" from her settlement? She still came out seven million richer. Why are you protecting her? She will never get the help she needs if we all stay silent!"

Anna Akana posted on twitter: "I just spent the entire day deep diving into the Amber Heard & Johnny Depp situation and WOW. I'm ashamed that I believed this woman who cried wolf, and I'm deeply angry that her lies hurt real victims. He's one of the victims that is being discredited due to her false accusations. Though men are a smaller percentage of abused victims, they are also ones that face more stigma/dismissiveness. She knew this and exploited it :( "

"I listened to the hour conversation that both knew was being recorded, the half hour conversation Amber secretly recorded & a telephone conversation Depp recorded. There was a clear pattern in all of verbal and emotional abuse by Heard. Not being able to promise that you won't hit someone again is insane."

It’s really good to see celebrities standing up and speaking out in favor of Johnny Depp. I wish more people would follow suit. He’s a super nice guy that’s worked with a LOT of people in the industry, and I wish more of them would stand up and show their support.

Who would you like to see step up and speak out? Drop a comment and let us know.

title: Amber Heard bullies Johnny Depp
description:
Johnny Depp is ordered to appear for three successive days in counsel for the defendant’s offices on November 10th, 11th, and 12th, beginning at 10am. And he has to pay her the cost of filing this motion, as well as whatever other reasonable costs apply.

So, basically, Johnny has to pay Amber for bullying him into interrupting filming in London in order to appear in Virginia for a deposition that easily could have waited until after his filming was concluded.

Let’s keep in mind that it’s not just three days at stake. There are quarantine periods as well. So it’s not just a matter of days that filming is being disrupted by. It could be weeks.

While I’m sure it’s Amber’s intention to jerk Johnny around – maybe even get him fired from FB3 – she’s also meddling with WB, forcing them to reschedule Johnny’s filming and having to film around him. Is this something she’d pull if she were still affiliated with Aquaman 2? I don’t think so. She wouldn’t risk her status with them if she still had the part.

Heard might be feeling all victorious right about now, winning this little battle. But one battle doesn’t win the war, and she will not win this one. The verdict will come down from London soon about Depp’s libel case against the Sun for calling him a wife beater, and when it does, the whole world will be put on notice that the courts aren’t buying her story about being a battered wife. The court in London won’t buy it, and neither will the court in Virginia.

She can enjoy what little bit of money she gets from Johnny right now, right up until she’s forced to pay him $50 million for his defamation case. Since she’s not worth that much to begin with, it’ll be interesting to see where she gets the money.

She can enjoy pushing him around for now, too. Because while she’s getting her way this time, she does no control Johnny Depp any more. He caught wise to what kind of a monster she really is, and kicked her to the curb. Sure, he’ll have to sit for the deposition, but she will not be the one asking questions. She shouldn’t even be in the room, though I’m sure she’ll find a way to insert herself so that she can stare him down and witness his defeat. But that’s the end of it. He’s moved on with his life and regained his happiness. And no matter how much she thinks she can push him around, she can’t take that away from him. Never again.

And she can go ahead and enjoy breathing free air, while she can. She’s got several chances to be thrown behind bars hanging over her head. First, there’s no statute of limitations in Australia for violence that results in grievous bodily harm. Like cutting off somebody’s finger. The only reason she hasn’t been brought up on charges is because Johnny hasn’t filed a claim against her. She owes the fact that she’s not in jail right now to the man she’s pushing around. She needs to think about that.

Second, Australia’s looking at her for Perjury in the case where she brought the yorkies, Pistol and Boo, into the country illegally. She lied in her statement to authorities, and now they know it.

And, depending on how the verdict comes down in London, she could very well be facing perjury charges there, too. She lied her ass off in her testimony to the British courts, just like she’s lied for the past four years about Johnny.

Will they seek perjury charges in Virginia after she lies there, too? They certainly could. So let her do her little victory dance at this perceived victory. She won’t be laughing when it’s all over.

What do you think? Will the London judge rule in favor of Depp or Heard? What do you think will happen in Virginia? Will Heard manage to pull another rabbit out of her hat? Or will Johnny prevail, clearing his name and forcing her to face justice? Drop a comment and let us know.

SOURCE

title: All Quiet
description:
All is pretty quiet while we wait for Justice Nicol to hand down his ruling in Johnny Depp's libel case against the Sun tabloid. Nobody's really up to anything newsworthy. 

If I were so inclined, I could post pictures of the inane things Amber Heard's been up to, from riding her horse, and a lesson horse, badly with the wrong tack, to her hanging her nipples out for the world to see (again) in that same see-through top that she wore to meet Jason Momoa and a gaggle of kids for an Aquaman event.

But I'm not so inclined. It's not news, even if these base, nonsensical tidbits get posted in the Daily Fail (mail) tabloid.

I have to wonder who she's got on her payroll to get them to post her non-event, inappropriate photos. SOMEbody's got to be getting paid for that. It also makes me wonder who's footing the bill. She got paid not to appear in Aquaman 2, so she's got a little bit of money. But she lives outside her means, and somebody's got to be picking up the tab. 

Hopefully, we'll hear a ruling soon. Then we can celebrate, since Johnny is certain to win. And then we can look forward to the Virginia case, which Johnny is also certain to win, hands down. Heard spend years portraying herself as the victim of Depp's abuse, when the truth is that she was the abusive one. He lost his job as Captain Jack Sparrow due to her allegations. It's only right that he should be compensated for it. 

As much as I enjoy updating this petition and interacting with all of you, this petition was created to be temporary. When it's confirmed beyond any doubt that Heard isn't in Aquaman 2, I can claim this petition to be a victory and put it to bed. 

Until then, I'll bring you the latest as I find it.

title: Ms. Heard's counterclaim is subject to dismissal on multiple grounds
description:
A new reply by Johnny Depp's legal team addresses how Amber Heard's counterclaim should be dismissed for multiple reasons. 

First, she fails to state a claim for declaratory judgement. In her opposition, Ms. Heard fails to state a single case recognizing the viability of a standalone claim for a declaratory judgement. Basically, she's outta gas because of anti-SLAPP statutes.

Second, Ms. Heard fails to allege computer crimes under the VA code. She can't cite where the alleged "smear campaign" is immoral or unlawful. Further, she can't prove that anything said by Mr. Depp was obscene or illegal as it relates directly to her.

And third, calling someone a liar isn't defamation. Especially if they've already been proven to be a liar.

In short, Heard's counterclaim is a whole bunch of her being butthurt, without any legal substance. 

What do you think? Should Heard's counterclaim be dismissed? Or will she get to keep beating Johnny over the head with it? Let us know.

SOURCE

title: WB: We don't need her
description:
I keep hearing Amber stans (die-hard fans) insisting that since there's no official word from WB about Aquaman 2, there's no proof that Amber Heard won't be in the movie.

Well here's an email from WB saying that they don't need her. 

I think that's about as official as it gets. Don't you?

I know that this email is in a specific context for a specific date and time, but I think that it's indicative of the fact that there's truth to the assertion that WB has bought out Heard's contract, and that she will not appear in Aquaman 2.

What do you think? Are you convinced that Amber Heard will not be in Aquaman 2, or are you still on the fence?

title: Depp asks court to tell Heard to cool her jets
description:
Johnny Depp's legal team has responded to Amber Heard's request that he interrupt filming to sit for a deposition in Virginia. 

"Ms Heard has again filed a gratuitous motion, wasting the court's resources." Depp's opposition begins. "Requiring Depp to disrupt the shooting, which involves 750 people, and make what would be unnecessary flights between London and Virginia during the COVID pandemic, as Ms. Heard irresponsibly requests, would also endanger Mr. Depp's health, And that of everyone with whom he would come into contact."

Johnny's team reminds the court that he's already agreed to sit for his deposition after filming is complete, and requests that Heard and her team be patient until then. 

What do you think? Will Heard wait for Johnny to finish filming, or will she continue to demand that he interrupt filming to go sit for a 3 day deposition in Virginia? Is she trying to disrupt filming to strain the relationship between Johnny and WB so that they won't want to work with him again? Or is she just so petty that she wants to be a thorn in his side? Does she want him to catch COVID by demanding that he travel? What do you think her game is? Let us know.

SOURCE

title: Heard accuses Depp of dodging deposition
description:
Amber Heard has asked a Virginia judge to force ex-husband Johnny Depp to finally sit down for an elongated examination with her attorneys.

"Defendant is forced to bring this motion after extensive efforts to obtain the deposition of Plaintiff, even after providing a two-month Notice of Deposition, asking for locations and dates for Mr. Depp prior to his filming, seeking discovery to ascertain Mr. Depp's exact filming schedule, and finally being told that the Plaintiff in this action, suing Defendant for $50 million, will not make himself available for deposition until the filming of Fantastic Beasts is complete, sometime late February 2021, or possibly later," lawyers for the star state, reported Deadline.

Heard is once again trying to get the case dismissed or seeking an assurance that Depp shows up "for three successive days in counsel for Defendant's offices in Virginia on or before October 30, 2020 on dates and times agreeable to counsel for Defendant."

A hearing has been set for 9 October before Fairfax County, Virginia, Circuit Court Chief Judge Bruce White on the matter, with another hearing on sanctions against Depp's main lawyer Adam Waldman scheduled for 23 October.

SOURCE

title: Amber Heard getting political
description:
It seems that Amber Heard is starting to pursue some political ambitions. She's recently come out swinging in favor of Joe Biden for President, and is now inserting herself into social events with political overtones.

Today at 5pm pt/8pm est, Heard will attend a political rally of sorts featuring foster kids. According to the website: 

"Join us for a town hall with Foster Youth for Biden featuring actress and United Nations Human Rights Champion Amber Heard and Congressmember Karen Bass. Learn what is at stake for foster care and child welfare reform, why the issue matters this election season, and how to foster action."

What do you think? Does Heard really care about foster kids? Or Joe Biden, for that matter? Or is this just the latest "cause" she's hitching her wagon to in order to 1) get her name in the headlines, 2) try to make herself seem relevant and caring? Is she going to try to go into politics since her acting career is down the toilet? 

Drop a line and let us know what you think.

SOURCE

title: Heard's Motion DENIED
description:
Amber Heard's motions for sanctions against Johnny Depp is DENIED. 

In yet another win for Johnny Depp, the court denies Heard's motion for Johnny to be punished for her percieved crimes against him, which still includes saying that he started this petition.

Many more wins for Johnny to come.

title: An open letter to Amber Heard
description:
I'm going to keep this short and sweet.

Twitter user @TheInfamousOne6 has penned an open letter to Amber Heard. I strongly suggest that anybody interested in this case read it. It's an intelligent, thoughtful look at dealing with a toxic narcissist - in this case, Amber Heard.

Not only does it provide insights into the thought processes and motivations of a toxic narcissist, it does so with a pretty comprehensive timeline. Well worth the read.

Quick warning. It contains sensitive and emotional triggers, so be sure to look after your emotional well-being while reading it.

When you've read it, come back and let us know what you think.

title: Amber Heard goes after Johnny Depps attorney
description:
In her latest motions, Amber Heard asks the court to sanction Adam Waldman, Johnny Depp’s lawyer, preventing him from communicating with the press, social media, or any potential third party witnesses about this case. In short, she doesn’t want Waldman to post on Twitter.

She says that “Throughout this litigation, Mr. Waldman has acted like anything but an attorney this Court has a right to expect.”

In her memorandum, Heard insists that Mr. Depp has defamed her through Mr. Waldman’s statements as Mr. Depp’s agent, and has orchestrated a robust social media campaign against her through the use of inauthentic social media accounts (i.e. not real accounts by real people) casting aspersions on Heard while often praising Mr. Depp and Mr. Waldman. The conduct for which Defendant now seeks sanctions is related but distinct from the conduct alleged in Heard’s counterclaims.

What that means is that this isn’t the same assertion she made in her counterclaim, this is a completely new motion asking the court to make Mr. Waldman stop posting on social media.

More than that, it looks like she’s trying to get Adam Waldman thrown off the case all together, saying that “the court has the right to revoke the pro had admission of Depp’s lawyer (Waldman), if his behavior on social media adversely impacts the administration of justice.”

Admission pro hac vice is when a lawyer from another jurisdiction is allowed to practice in another area. Virginia isn’t Adam Waldman’s normal stomping ground, so Heard wants him thrown off the case.

The reasons she says he should be dismissed aren’t just his actions on social media. She also blames Waldman for leaking Josh Dre’s deposition transcript. She goes on and on about Waldman on Twitter, having puppies and kittens about other “leaked” materials and laundered information.

What it really means is that Waldman’s doing his job, Heard can’t stand it, and she’s doing everything she can to get rid of him.

It also looks like she’s so jealous of Johnny’s popularity on social media that she can’t see straight. He gets hundreds of thousands of “likes” on his Instagram posts, none of which have had a single thing to do with her.

On top of asking for all these sanctions, Heard also asks the court to award her the cost of filing these motions in the first place. She wants to fling mud at Depp and his legal team, and she wants Depp to pay for her to do it. Talk about nerve.

What do you think? Will she be successful in getting rid of Adam Waldman? Or will the court tell her to sit down and shut up? Yeah, me too.

SOURCE

title: Heard moves to dismiss - AGAIN
description:
Amber Heard has filed yet again for dismissal. In this motion, she tries to bully Johnny Depp into appearing at her lawyer's offices in Virginia for three days, right in the middle of his filming schedule for Fantastic Beasts 3.

"Defendedt Amber Lura Heard, by counsel, hereby moves this court for an Order granting appropriate relief and sanctions, to include the dismissal of the Complaint, with prejudice, compelling production of the 9th RPTs, compelling Plaintiff Mr. Depp to appear for three successive days in counsel for the defendant's offices in Virginia on or before October 30, 2020 on dates and times agreeable to counsel for the Defendant, and to award fees and costs to Defendant for having to bring this motion."

Again, it looks like she's trying to cost Johnny his gig in FB3 by being so troublesome that the franchise doesn't deem him worth keeping around. It's a despicable tactic, and I hope that the court slaps her down for it.

What do you think? Will she get him fired from Beasts with her pesky behavior? Or will he continue to shine in his magnificent career while she fades away into oblivion?

title: Judge rules that Heard has to prove where the money went
description:
A judge has ruled that Heard has to put her money where her mouth is. Specifically, she’s going to have to prove how much of her divorce settlement was actually donated to charity, where it went and how much.

From court documents:  

“Second, discovery into whether Heard did, in fact, as she publicly claims, donate her $7 million divorce settlement to charity, is relevant to Ms. Heard’s motive in making the domestic abuse allegations against Depp. Defendant proclaimed to the world that “money played no role” in her divorce with Mr. Depp, promising that all settlement proceeds would be donated to charity, particularly to vulnerable and abused populations. Mr. Depp should be able to show that Ms. Heard’s false abuse claims were to leverage a larger settlement, that she did not donate the entirety of the proceeds. In connection with a third-party subpoena pending before the Hon. Stephanie M. Bowick of California, that court has already tentatively agreed with Depp that Heard put her donations at issue, and that the truth of Heard’s claims to have donated the settlement proceeds is relevant and discoverable. This evidence is directly relevant to Heard’s motives, and the motion is nothing more than a blatant attempt by Heard to end run a well warranted adverse ruling in California.”

Depp’s legal team submitted a motion to discover whether or not Heard had actually donated all of the money, and Heard’s team objected. But in yet another win for Johnny, a judge agreed with him. Details about the settlement are relevant to Heard’s motives in making abuse allegations against Depp.

So, in short, Heard is going to have to prove where the divorce money went. Did she donate it? Did she donate part of it and keep the rest for herself? Did she donate any of it?

Her little world is getting smaller and smaller, and she’s running out of places to hide.

title: Amber Heard NOT confirmed for Aquaman 2
description:
According to an interview with James Wan, the director of Aquaman and AM2:

"The official cast of Aquaman 2 hasn’t been revealed however, nonetheless, we do know that Jason Momoa will reprise his place of Arthur Curry / Aquaman. Other than him, Patrick Wilson who carried out the place of Orm Marius / Ocean Grasp (Arthur’s half-brother and former king of Atlantis) will even make his return, and in response to him, ‘Wan’s concepts for Aquaman 2 are pushing it even extra.’ Yahya Abdul-Mateen II has moreover confirmed his return and whereas others are however to be revealed, we anticipate to see Willem Dafoe, Amber Heard, and Nicole Kidman once more in movement as properly."

Anticipated. Not confirmed.

While WB might never make an official statement that Heard has been bought out and dropped from the film, there are a LOT of clues that hint at it, from a statement on court that Heard was SUPPOSED to be in AM2 to this, a statement from the film's director that doesn't confirm that she's in it. 

The biggest clue of all might come from her countersuit against Johnny Depp, wherein she claims to have lost a total of $100 million in salary and damages because of him. The only major payday she had on the line was Aquaman. So she's saying she lost Aquaman 2 because of Johnny Depp, right?

Aquaman 2 is due to be released on 16th December 2022. We might have to wait until then for proof that she's not in the film.

What do you think? Will it take the film coming out without her in it before you believe that she's out? Or are the clues enough? Me, I believe that she's out because I believe the sources that say so - and no, I won't name them, so don't ask. They're insiders in the industry, and haven't been wrong yet.

If only they could CGI her out of the first one, I'd be able to enjoy it.

SOURCE

title: Meanwhile, in San Sebastian..
description:
Johnny Depp spent some time at the San Sebastian International Film Festival looking healthy and happy.

He took a moment to thank his fan base as his very public legal war against ex-wife Amber Heard continued last week.

And amid the ongoing drama with his ex, Johnny Depp was seen arriving at the Maria Cristina Hotel during 68th San Sebastian International Film Festival on Saturday.

The actor, 57, opted for a typically quirky look as he arrived wearing a Ramones T-shirt and a baker boy style cap with aviator shades.

Depp was in San Sebastian to attend the premiere of "Crock of Gold, directed by Julien Temple. The film combines unseen footage from the Pogues and MacGowan's family and is described as a 'celebration' of the star.

Depp is also scheduled to reprise his role of Gellart Grindelwald, with filming on Fantastic Beasts 3 to resume filming any day now. Filming should be finished just in time for Depp to gear up for his Defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard, now scheduled to commence on May 17th, 2021.

By all accounts, Depp is staying busy, staying healthy and looking happy as he interacts with fans and gets on with his life. Congratulations to him for coming out the other side happy and whole.

SOURCE

title: Remove Amber Heard as spokesperson for L'oreal
description:
Hillary Deanna started THIS PETITION to remove Amber Heard as a spokesperson for L'Oréal. She cites many of the same reasons for her petition that I had when I started the petition to remove Heard from Aquaman 2.

"Amber Heard, for years now has been claiming to be the victim of abuse from her husband Johnny Depp. In light of recently leaked recorded sessions between Ms. Heard and Mr. Depp, it has come to the attention of many that it was in fact the other way around.

If roles were reversed, Mr. Depp would have (and has had) many of his, if not all of his roles, and sponsorships taken away. Why should this be any different in the case of Ms. Heard, as it now known who the true abuser is?

L'Oreal, it is time to remove Amber Heard as a spokesperson for your products. She has misrepresented herself, the "me too" movement, and should in no way be in a leadership position, or viewed as a role model for girls and women." 

I couldn't have said it better myself.

If you haven't yet signed the petition to remove Amber Heard as a spokesperson for L'oreal, consider stopping by to sign it HERE.

title: The Fishing Trip
description:
The latest from the Depp/Heard fiasco is Amber Heard seeking even more documents from Depp, insisting that he should have produced them already. These documents include correspondence between Johnny and:
(his sister) Christi Dembrowski
Ben King
Kevin Murphy
Jerry Judge
Nathan Holmes
Malcolm Connelly
Steven Deuters
any other security for Mr. Depp
Mick Doohan (owner of the Australia house)
House personnel
Housekeeping
Personal assistant staff

That relate to:
Mr. Depp’s substance abuse
Mr. Depp’s alcohol abuse
Mr. Depp’s substance abuse treatment
Mr. Depp’s acts of physical violence
Mr. Depp’s destruction of property
Mr. Depp’s finger injury
Ms. Heard’s 2016 domestic violence restraining order
Evidence or testimony related thereto
Allegations of physical or nonphysical abuse by Ms. Heard or Mr. Depp
Allegations that these are false, part of a hoax or fraud and/or that otherwise refer or relate to the claims, counterclaims, defenses or allegations in this lawsuit from January 1st, 2013 through the present.

She doesn’t want much, does she? Basically, she’s asking for any communication he ever had with anybody on the planet during that time that was about her.

She probably thinks that she’s going to find some incriminating morsel that she can wave around as proof that he’s a monster. But more likely, I think this fishing expedition is only going to find correspondence that corroborates Depp’s version of events.

Even more likely, Heard is asking for this staggering amount of communication to create even more of a paper blizzard to try to bury the facts in this case, that she defamed Johnny Depp by calling him a domestic abuser. No amount of paperwork is going to eradicate the fact that she’s doomed when it comes not only to the verdict in London, but in the VA defamation case as well.

See, when it comes to light that she perjured herself in London, that fact comes straight to Virginia, and applies directly to Depp’s defamation case against her.

It’s my guess that she’s trying to get ahead of the London verdict, which looms near, and kick up such a paperwork dust storm that she can hide her apparent guilt.

Not gonna work. But she’ll have to find that out for herself.

What do you think? Will all this paperwork bury Heard's guilt? Or is she just plain screwed?

title: Trial by Jury
description:
Originally, the Defamation trial date was continued to May 3rd, but it now looks like the trial is set instead for May 17th at 10am. And, according to this report, the trial is set to take 4 weeks. 

That's 4 weeks to wade through all of Heard's ridiculous accusations against Johnny Depp, and Johnny's mountain of evidence proving that she's a liar. And, more than that, that she was the abuser in the relationship. I know it and you know it, but Johnny's got to prove it to the judge and jury. Is 4 weeks long enough for all that?

That's something else that's different from the London trial. This one's marked to be a trial by jury at the request of both parties. Looks like Heard thinks that she can convince them with her horrible acting and obviously fake testimony.

They're already looking at Heard for Perjury in Australia. It's possible that the UK will be looking at her for Perjury once the London verdict comes down. I wonder what the sentence for perjury is in the United States, particularly Virginia. Anybody know?

The statute of limitations is over in America for everything Amber Did to Johnny, Tasya, Kate James, Whitney, and all the other victims she's left in her wake, so she won't do any time for any of those crimes. 

There is no statute of limitations in Australia, though, for any assault resulting in grievous bodily harm. She will have the possibility of serving time in Australia for cutting Johnny's finger off for the rest of her life. 

And, more recently, she's racking up quite a list of places where she can and should be charged for perjury. Oh, how I hope they take turns locking her up for it. 

What do you think? Will Australia, the UK, or Virginia go after her for perjury? Or will she get away with it and walk away fancy free?

Hat tip to the Real Laura B.

title: A sign of things to come
description:
Amber Heard has been removed from packaging for Aquaman, as well as not being mentioned in the cast credits for Aquaman 2 in google searches. She's still listed on Aquaman 2's IMDB page, but her name's dropping on the list. Jason Momoa's name is firmly at the top now, where it has belonged the whole time.

IMDB probably won't be updated until after the movie comes out with its confirmed cast. That's probably when Amber Heard will update her IMDB without Aquaman 2 on it, too, since she'll have no choice, then. 

These few little snippets aren't conclusive. They aren't confirmation by any means, but I think they're a sign of things to come. It looks like WB is slowly but surely weaning her out of its existence. 

What do you think? Am I reading too much into it? Or is Amber Heard OUT?

Photo source: @wwfrills on Twitter.

title: Defamation trial delay granted
description:
Fairfax County Circuit Court Chief Judge Bruce White has granted Johnny Depp’s request for a delay in his defamation trial against ex wife Amber Heard. The trial was set for Jan. 11, which coincides with the filming schedule for another installment of the “Fantastic Beasts” series in which Depp will star, prompting his lawyers to request a continuance last month. But Heard objected to the delay.  

According to Heard, she was told that Aquaman 2 would start filming in February, 2021. See that claim HERE.

Problem is that she’s all wrong.

WB wrote a letter regarding both FB3 and AM2, which says that they “require Mr. Depp to be in the United Kingdom from September 17th 2020 through the anticipated end of production in mid-February 2021.”

“As to Aquaman 2, that film will not start production any earlier that May 31, 2021.”

Notice how they name Johnny Depp and specifically address his filming schedule. But they don’t name Amber Heard or address her filming schedule. They refer to AM2 as “that film” and make no reference to Heard at all.

It also goes to show that Heard is completely out of the loop with regard to AM2 production. She thought filming was going to start in February, when in fact, production is going to start months later. Seems to me if she were going to be involved with the movie, she would have been informed by now. All the principals have to know these things early so they can schedule accordingly.

From the look of it, Heard has no idea whatsoever what’s going on with AM2. If she were returning as Mera, she’d be in the loop.

I’m taking it as a good sign that Heard’s out of AM2, straight from the horse’s mouth.

SOURCE

title: Amber Heard subpoenas Disney
description:
You heard that right. She's subpoenaed Disney.

According to THIS filing, Amber Heard’s legal team has issued a subpoena to Disney asking for certain documents. These include:

1. All documents or communications with Mr. Depp that refer or relate to Ms. Heard
2. All documents or communications concerning the relationship between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard, including, but not necessarily limited to any violence or abuse between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard.
3. All documents or communications concerning any actual, alleged, or attempted acts of violence involving Mr. Depp.
4. All documents or communications concerning any actual alleged, or attempted alcohol or drug use or abuse by Mr. Depp from 2013 to present.
5. All documents of communications concerning any actual or alleged act of Mr. Depp that resulted in damage to property.
6. All documents concerning any decision to cast or not cast Mr. Depp in any future Pirates of the Caribbean films.
7. All contracts with or relating to Mr. Depp relating to the Pirates of the Caribbean franchise.
8. All documents or communications relating to any interviews, communications, or correspondence with press or entertainment trade publications concerning Mr. Depp.
9. All non-privileged documents or communications concerning any insurance policy or claims relating to any performance by Mr. Depp.

I hardly know where to start. So I’ll just start at the top. Any communications with Depp that relate to Ms. Heard. Why the hell would there be any communication between Disney and Ms. Heard? Does Heard’s team think that Johnny regularly chatted up Disney about his marriage? That’s ridiculous. Disney isn’t any one person, it’s a legal entity that exists on many levels, none of which includes marriage counseling. If there’s any communication, it’s from Disney telling Johnny that his wife was banned from the set because she was such a troublemaker during filming.

Number 2, same thing. There’s no reason there would be communications between Johnny and Disney about Heard at all, let alone anything about violence. But this is a slippery slope for Heard. IF there were any communications about violence, they are most likely about her being violent, not him.

Number 3, asked and answered by number 2.

Number 4, any actual alleged, or attempted alcohol or drug use or abuse by Mr. Depp. First, it’s ridiculous to think that Disney babysat Johnny while he filmed, to know what he did or didn’t do or drink. It would only be addressed if any such substance abuse became a problem for filming. Johnny is a consummate professional. We’ve never heard that he was drunk on set. Just that he’s a delight to work with. And secondly, what the hell is ATTEMPTED alcohol or drug use? That’s such an absurd phrase that I’m surprised any lawyer dared to put such a silly thing in actual court papers. Well, I guess they’ll do anything they’re paid to do.

Number 5, Damage. What do they think? That Johnny wantonly went around smashing sets? For one thing, we would have heard about it in tabloids at the time. For another, Disney wouldn’t have kept employing him if he were prone to smashing things up. They didn’t dump him until Heard branded him as a wife-beater.

Number 6, Any decision to cast or recast him in future films. That’s not a legal argument, it’s a personal fishing expedition. Yes, Johnny’s asking for 50m because that’s what he’s out for losing Pirates, but it reads more like she’s just desperate to know what work he’ll be getting.

Number 7, Asked and answered by number 6.

Number 8, This is far too broad a request to be feasible. Any interviews, EVER, relating to Disney? Besides, what has his interviews got to do with her defaming him? This comes across as Amber trying to create such a fuss with Disney that they won’t want to work with Johnny because of her. I hope the studio, and the judge, see through this abusive tactic and sent her packing.

Number 9, any insurance policy or claims relating to any performance by Mr. Depp. I find this one to be really interesting. The way filming works is that actors have to be bonded, insured, in order to film. Can’t film without being insured. So we already know that Johnny was insured for all past jobs with Disney or they wouldn’t have happened. So this is another fishing expedition to find out if Johnny is insured for future projects, Pirates or otherwise. She’s desperate to know what work he might have lined up with Disney in the future. It reeks of her wanting to know so that she can muck it up for him. I also think this request for his insurance information is highly ironic, since Heard herself is uninsurable. It reads to me like she's saying, “If I can’t work, neither can he!”

Remind me again, who was the abuser here? Her supporters would say that he’s the abuser by insisting upon these two court cases: the libel case in London and the Defamation case against her in VA. But let’s not forget that during negotiations for their divorce, he BEGGED her to finish it up quietly to avoid court. He didn’t want to hurt her reputation, he wanted to let her walk away. But it was SHE who kept running her mouth to any outlet she could think of, or pay for, labeling him as an abusive spouse and painting herself as the poor, embattled victim. She tried to ruin him, and she’s still trying to ruin him. Only now, it’s not just the public that gets to decide. It’s a judge and a court, and they’re not as gullible as I’m sure she hopes they are. A few flimsy lies aren’t going to hold up. They’re too easily debunked, and that’s what’s going on. Johnny is presenting evidence that he didn’t do what she says he did. She’s just hoping that if she throws enough paperwork into the air, it’ll distract away from the evidence.

Sorry, kid, but it doesn’t work that way. Those judgments are coming, sooner than later. And there’s not going to be anywhere to hide.

All she’s managing to do with this little stunt of hers is ensure that Disney will never want to work with her. Johnny will be just fine once she’s legally forced to shut her yap. I, for one, can’t wait for that day.

Hat tip to Qwerty, the Real Laura B, and the Depp army on Twitter.

title: Depp-osition
description:
Amber Heard's been screaming that Johnny Depp refuses to sit for his deposition, saying that he's dragging things out to torture her.

As things stand right now, Depp is scheduled to sit for his deposition on October 5th, most likely via video link, though that's almost certain to change.

Depp has filed for a continuance to allow for his filming schedule for Fantastic Beasts 3. Heard, naturally, is having fits about it. She thinks that Depp should be able to schedule his filming around court obligations, saying that Depp "has made no effort to schedule around his deposition and this trial. The case needs to end, and end soon."

That's not the way things work, of course, but there's no telling Heard that. She claims that Johnny and his lawyer Adam Waldman are waging a "campaign of terror" against her by posting on social media, and she calls for this abuse to end as soon as possible. And never mind that it is she who's been slandering him by way of every public platform that she can think of (or pay for) since they divorced. For her, it seems, it's "Do as I say, not as I do."

The thing is, they want five days for Depp's deposition, which Depp's side has argued is too long. They are also refusing to allow him to depo in London via WebX because AH wants a lawyer there, which would require 14 day quarantine period. 

So while Heard is screaming about postponements, SHE'S the one making it difficult for him to sit for his deposition. 

What do you think? Is Johnny dragging his feet by asking for a continuance? Or is Heard continuing to try to control and manipulate him? 

Hat tip to @LauraBockov
SOURCE

title: 1,000 words
description:
They say that a picture is worth a thousand words. Well, I'd like to take a look at this one.

Amber said that nobody would believe that she abused Johnny because he's so much bigger than her. I think she used the words 'twice her size.' Looking at this picture, you can see that it's not exactly true.

I understand that she was probably wearing heels for this photo, but still. It's not like he towers over her. She's as tall as Johnny, or nearly as tall, and we know that weight has nothing to do with someone's ability to throw a haymaker. Her argument about him being twice her size just doesn't wash.

Something else about this picture I can't help noticing is how smug she looks, while he looks miserable. Like many of the photos of them together from the time they were together, he looks like he's withdrawn, trapped, and begging for help with his eyes.

Now that he's finally rid of Amber, let's just hope that Johnny finds someone who treats him with love, dignity, and respect, so that he never has to look this miserable again.

title: Support for Johnny Depp grows
description:
Mark Rylance, Depp’s costar in Waiting for the Barbarians, has stepped forward in support of Johnny depp.

“My impression of him was a very loving and very sensitive and very trustworthy person,” Rylance said of Depp. “Intensely, intensely shy. You know? Like Daniel Day-Lewis and so many great actors are. The accusations that were around at the time we were making the film were of physical violence. And he obviously denied this and I found his denial completely believable. It didn’t seem to be part of his character at all.”

Likewise, Snoop Dogg is feeling the Johnny love.

It’s nice to see more and more people stepping forward with support for Johnny Depp. I think it’s finally sinking in that he was the innocent party, and that Amber Heard is the one who was abusive in the relationship.

Hell, she still is being abusive, asking to be informed about just about every minute of every day of his life. She’s even demanding his call sheets for filming, which are usually not even typed up until the day before filming. She’s contacting WB about him, demanding information. It seems to me that she’s trying to pester WB into firing Johnny because SHE’S too much of a pain in the arse for them to keep dealing with.

And that begs the question: IF Amber were still an Aquaman, how would this pestering bode for her. Nah, folks. This sounds like somebody who’s got nothing to lose from WB, meaning she’s already out of Aquaman.

It also comes across as Amber being insanely jealous that Johnny still has his blockbuster franchise, while she’s out of hers.

Maybe she should have thought of that before she beat the shit out of Johnny and then caused herself to be unbondable. She might still have the job.

She had the kindest, nicest guy on the planet, and she couldn’t keep from ruining that buy abusing him. Then she had one of the biggest film franchises on the planet, and she wrecked that, too. Poor little psycho just can’t keep hold of a good thing, can she?

SOURCE

title: Amber Heard doesn't want a continuance
description:
Amber Heard has filed opposition to Johnny Depp’s request for a continuance, for a whole bunch of reasons. She says that his need to work is not “good cause” for a continuance, and that if the court grants one, it will set a “highly problematic” precedent. He could, and should have worked his filming schedule around his deposition instead. She thinks, apparently, that Depp has the power to make a multi-million dollar film, its cast, crew, and schedule revolve around him, at her whim.

Doesn’t work that way. It would cost millions for the movie to wait for him to go to court, if that were even possible. Court is flexible. Filming a movie is not.

Heard also says that it is of the utmost importance that the trial proceed as scheduled so that she can put a stop to Depp’s “daily” smear campaign of her through social media.

More than that, she bemoans the cost of maintaining her legal defense for an additional five months, the amount of time Depp is seeking.

She says that requesting a continuance, in part, because of Covid protocols, shouldn’t happen because even though it is good cause, it’s already been done twice. Apparently, she thinks twice is enough, and never mind that the pandemic is far from being resolved.

With regard to filming schedules, Heard says that she was told that Aquaman was going to start filming sometime in the spring – WB didn’t tell her exactly when. So, if she’s in the movie, a continuance would interfere with HER filming schedule.

We already know that she’s not in Aquaman 2, and she knows it, too. She’s pulling this out of her arse just to try to deny his request for a continuance. I mean, I can be TOLD that Aquaman is filming in the spring. That doesn’t mean I’ll be in it. Doesn’t mean she will, either. And for them not to tell her exactly when filming starts is a huge red flag. Johnny’s known for months ahead of time when FB3 was going to start filming. Certainly, if she was going to be in a blockbuster, she’d know when she was supposed to show up to film it so that she could arrange her schedule accordingly.

Heard went on to slam Adam Waldman, Johnny Depp’s lawyer, claiming that he’s done all sorts of things that are improper, maybe even illegal, based on social media posts that she doesn’t like.

I think my favorite line is when she says that she “intends to vindicate herself at trial.” Just like she did in London? Because that was just one big Charlie Foxtrot for her.

Every day that passes, she insists, provides further opportunity for Depp and Waldman to smear her good name, tarnish her reputation, and irreparably damage her career, which has long been Depp’s stated goal.

His STATED goal? When and where did he STATE that his goal is to irreparably damage her career? She needs to be careful with her wording. She’s already being sued for defamation. I don’t think it’s the best idea for her to defame him in ongoing court documents.

I have paraphrased a long document, so please feel free to read the whole thing HERE. It’s a whole lot of her saying she doesn’t want to court to grant Depp a continuance, without much – if any – substantial reason why he shouldn’t get it. All she’s got is her nonexistent filming schedule and a nonexistent smear campaign by Depp and his lawyer. Basically, she’s got nothing.

Please have a read and tell me if you agree. Does she have any good reasons why Depp shouldn’t get a continuance, or is she flat outta gas?

title: The Clock is Ticking
description:
If  I understand this correctly, Amber Heard and her legal team have until September 28th to explain what work she's lost that adds up to the 100 million she's asking for in her countersuit against Johnny Depp. 

Will she name Aquaman 2 among the work she's lost, admitting that she's not coming back to the water world? Or will she hold fast to the flimsy rumor that she's still going to be in it?

Don't forget, we've got it on good authority that WB bought out Heard's contract, sending her to the bench. Meaning that she got paid, but will not appear in Aquaman 2.

No, there hasn't been any official confirmation that she's out, and there likely won't be. The movie will simply come out without her in it. I wish there would be official word, but that's just not always the way it works, I'm sorry to say.

What other work will she be able to prove that Depp cost her through his false smear campaign to ruin her reputation on social media? Including the formation and manipulation of this very petition - according to her. What other movies did she have lined up that we bots have made her lose?

Word has it that she's unbondable. That means that she can't be insured during the production of a film. Without insurance, there's no part. Period. So, if that's the case, how is Johnny responsible? How are we?

We'll find out by the 28th whether or not she'll finally admit that she's out of the Aquaman franchise. As soon as I know, you will.

SOURCE
Fairfax County Gov website.
Hat tip to a certain Elf Pirate and the Netizens on Twitter. Without you guys, I would be nothing.

title: Johnny Depp asks for postponement
description:
Johnny Depp has asked for the defamation case against his ex wife Amber Heard, due to begin in January of 2021. 

The reason for the postponement is that Fantastic Beasts 3 is going to be filming from October this year until February of next year. So Johnny has asked for a postponement until May or June of 2021. 

A hearing on the filing will take place Sept. 11.

Meanwhile, a verdict on Depp’s libel suit against Rupert Murdoch’s U.K. tabloid The Sun is expected this week.

I have no doubt that Heard stans will be screaming that Johnny wants a postponement because he's running scared, or that he's putting other matters before legal matters, but neither could be further from the truth. 

The truth is that Johnny isn't in charge of the filming schedule for FB3. He can't ask for dozens (hundreds?) of cast and crew to sit around and wait for him to appear in court. Filming really can't be delayed. The trial can. 

More as it happens, folks.

SOURCE

title: It's happening!
description:
Slowly but surely, Amber Heard is being weaned out of Aquaman 2. It's already happened in our hearts and minds, but now the internet is starting to catch up. 

If you tell your phone to Google Aquaman 2 and then choose to look at the cast, you'll notice that Amber Heard is conspicuously missing from the photo lineup.

Sadly, she's still listed on the movie's IMDB, and the movie is still listed on Heard's IMDB, but hey. It's happening. Baby steps.

Like I've said before, we'll probably never get official confirmation from WB about her not being in AM2, but I think it'll be pretty definitive when the movie comes out and she's not in it.

Besides, if she WERE in it, she'd be yapping her head off about it, just to shut up all us "haters" - I'm sure. But she hasn't said a single word. Instead, she's been too busy showing off her nipples in Turkish places of worship. So, doesn't that speak volumes?

I may be making too much of this little development, but I am personally celebrating not seeing her face associated with Aquaman 2 on Google. 

How about you? Is this good news? Or am I jumping the gun?

title: Fandome
description:
Aquaman 2' Release Discussion At DCFanDome Noticeably Excluded Mention Of Amber Heard. 

During the DCFanDome panel, Aquaman 2 director James Wan discussed how the second film would expand upon the world of Jason Momoa's Aquaman. The director also stated that he was excited to continue the journeys of their heroes and expand their world in the second chapter.

Actor Patrick Wilson, who played King Orm, also discussed what he wanted from Aquaman 2 during the panel at DCFanDome. Patrick Wilson mentioned that he wanted the second movie to explore more of the ocean and explore “some new worlds”.

neither James Wan nor Patrick Wilson spoke about Heard's role in the sequel. The director and actor noticeably avoided talking about Amber Heard and the current controversy surrounding her. For those unaware, many fans want Amber Heard removed from Aquaman 2 due to her ongoing legal battle with Johnny Depp. 

In fact, fans even started a petition online asking for Amber Heard's removal from the movie. As of now, WB and the makers of Aquaman 2 have not yet commented on Amber Heard's role in the movie. Aquaman 2 is set to release sometime in December of 2022. 

Throughout the panel discussion, clips of the first Aquaman showed, including behind the scenes content about the making of the movie. But not once did they show a single image of Amber Heard. 

That leaves conspicuously unanswered the question of whether Amber Heard will return as Mera in AM2. We have heard from reputable sources, however, that WB bought out Heard's contract, quietly giving her the boot from the franchise. By all accounts, Amber Heard will not be returning for AM2. 

Will they write Mera out? A teaser for the Snyder Cut of Justice League shows Aquaman bowing out on Mera, like "See ya" - hinting perhaps that her exit will be predicted there. 

Will they recast Mera? The Twitterverse has some favorites in mind for the role. 

I guess we'll just have to wait and see. 
SOURCE

title: Amber Heard subpoenas Twitter
description:
Yes, you read that right.

Just when you think she’s grasped at the last straw, she goes and throws a hail Mary like this.

Me, I’m still trying to wrap my head around how she’s suing Johnny Depp for lost work that she already got paid for by the studio. She’s not going to be in Aquaman 2, from all reports, but the studio still paid her for it.

How bad to you have to suck for a studio to pay you NOT to be in their movie?

But yes. Now Amber’s throwing out more subpoenas, just about every day, trying to smoke up the mirrors, all while trying yet again to get the case dismissed.

You know, for a woman who insists that she will not be silenced, she’s trying awfully hard not to be heard.

Speaking of subpoenas, I haven’t been served with one yet, to go and testify that Johnny didn’t have anything to do with creating this petition. Maybe the fact that I keep saying it over and over is good enough. Or maybe they just haven’t gotten around to me yet. Or maybe I’m just not important enough to subpoena. I suspect the latter. But it would be a GAS to look that flappy wench in the eye while I testify. Well, once or twice. The view on the other side of the courtroom will likely be immensely more pleasant.

But there you have it.

Amber Heard subpoenaed Twitter. I’m pretty sure it’s just to get information about Adam Waldman’s communications, but still. Who DOES that?

title: The whole countersuit
description:
You can read Amber's entire counter claim HERE.

It's definitely worth a read, if you're in the mood for a good laugh. It's all about how Johnny is a big old meanie-weanie, stalking and harassing her online. She complains that he only created his Instagram account to harass her. 

Me, I think it just bugs her that he's got more followers than her. And all of his are real people while I'm willing to bet that the bulk of hers are bots, bought and paid for.

She's asking for a hundred million dollars, and whatever other relief that court deems appropriate, to repay her for what she calls his crusade to stalk and harass her online using "inauthentic" bots to bolster his popularity and pad the signatures on this petition, among others.

Go and give it a read, all you bots. Then come back and tell us what you think of it.

title: Amber Heard's countersuit
description:
Amber Heard has filed a countersuit. In it, she makes some pretty outlandish claims, saying that this petition is fake, and that so are many of the people who signed it. She calls you conspicuously fake and highly suspicious.

Remember when she called us all bots? Well, apparently she’s holding that position, while saying that not only are we bots, but that we’re bots on a Russian payroll.

She says: "These accounts exhibit behavior which includes but is not limited to tweet to retweet ratios in numbers implausible for authentic human users; they are created, attack Ms. Heard, then are set to inactive to avoid suspension; they utilize common language, patterns, and timing indicating broad coordination; they often offer little or no personal information, suggesting computer-control or a single individual controlling more than one account at a time (and often many more); and they republicize the content of one another at rates and consistencies that bely authentic human control."

Well, no kidding. They exhibit common language, timing and patterns because they’re all talking about the same topic, the TRUTH that Amber Heard abused Johnny Depp. There’s no collusion behind that. It’s the simple truth.

And as far as offering little to no personal information, it must REALLY bug her that she can’t find out who a few of you are. Good. Let her wonder who in the industry isn’t a bot and knows the truth about her that they aren’t shy to share.

She goes on to say: "These accounts are designed to damage Ms. Heard and her livelihood without being directly traceable to Mr. Depp. For example, it appears that a significant number of the accounts signing the petition to remove Ms. Heard from the Aquaman franchise are conspicuously fake or highly suspicious. The use of fake signatures on these petitions is well outside the skill set of the average internet troll or disgruntled fan. They reflect a concerted effort to damage Ms. Heard. In addition, the change.org petitions were modified to make it appear that far more people signed the petitions than actually did."

She says: "There are a number of newly created foreign language accounts specifically or predominantly designed to damage Ms. Heard. Many of these accounts have Cyrillic signatures, reflecting Russian origin. Mr. Waldman, Mr. Depp’s agent and attorney, is publicly associated with Russian individuals with the capability to organize such attacks."

She’s also attacking netizens on Twitter, calling out accounts for being fake. These include, ReemDepp, MyGrindelwald, Mderndarkwizard, pomta5426, depp_oldiar, PerspectiveDepp, depphead_, RayRayDepp, Depplyyours, ILoveGellert, Jackiedepp1963, JDeppS_girl.

Congratulations, kids, you’re famous!

And she says that investigation has revealed hundreds of others.

She doesn’t bother putting me on that list of fake accounts, which is good. It means that she knows I’m real. And, if I’m called to testify, she’ll have to come face to face with me. I look forward to looking her straight in the eye when I testify that all of you are real, too. To my knowledge, bots can’t sign the petition.

This petition is apparently getting under her skin in a big way, for her to keep mentioning it in court documents. To that, I say GOOD! Not only is this petition – by way of all of you – getting awareness out there about not just Johnny Depp, but other victims as well. But it also serves the double purpose of bugging her. That’s icing on the cake that I find to be delicious.

She’s desperate, folks, and it’s showing more every day. Looks like she's paranoid AF, too.

title: Amber Heard goes tits up in Istanbul
description:
Amber Heard posted pictures and video of herself touring a mosque in Istanbul, where local custom requires a hijab to be worn covering the hair and neck. Likewise, modest clothing should be worn at holy places. Heard wore what she calls a head scarf, but has half her hair hanging out. She also shows her neck and cleavage. To top it off, she’s braless in a sheer dress that clearly shows her nipples.

She got called out on it from netizens, most of whom found it to be extremely disrespectful for her to appear this way in a place of worship. Muslim commenters found her actions to be unforgivable.

Amber Heard has struck back. She writes: 'Nope. Apparently whoever paid 4 this to b “written” wasnt paid enough. 'Ill make it easy(ier): Mosques are real places. So are museums & churches. So are head scarfs (where they are sometimes required n order 2 visit). Mystery solved.'

First, she calls out the reporter for how the article is “written” then goes on to babble incoherently herself in gibberish that’s barely legible. She has little room to talk.

Second, the plural of scarf is scarves. Scarfs is loose slang for when one eats rapidly. And, more importantly, it’s not a simple head scarf. It’s a hijab, which when worn properly has social and religious meaning. She is obviously clueless not just about what it’s called, but what it represents.

Further, yes. Mosques are real places. They are places of worship which should be treated with respect. That respect does, indeed, require “head scarfs” to be worn, not just as fashion accessories for photo ops, but to be worn properly to show the place and the people the respect they deserve. By refusing to do that, she shows a staggering level of disrespect.

Her dress is likewise abysmally disrespectful, with her nipples clearly showing through. She was wearing a jacket which she could easily have pulled closed around her chest for modesty. But it’s clear that she has none. And there’s nothing wrong with that bohemian attitude on the streets of Soho, perhaps. But in a place of worship where people were praying, a place where modesty is expected, it goes down like a lead balloon.

It’s clear that her trip to the mosque was nothing more than a photo op. And when she got called on it, she’s completely without remorse. She lashes out like a child at the people that criticized her. She had a chance to learn something and be humble, even apologize, but instead chose to show her true colors. Vindictive and childish.

I, for one, just can’t wait for the judgement to come down in London, the first nail in her career coffin. Then for the judgement against her in Virginia, which will be the finish of her. Not that she really needs those judgments to finish her off. Word has it that not only is she removed from Aquaman 2, but that she’s also blacklisted. Nobody wants to work with her. And I don’t blame them. She comes across as a spoiled, selfish, abusive brat. Who wants to work with that?

More as it happens, my dears.

SOURCE

title: Amber Heard gone from L'oreal?
description:
I honestly don't know if Amber Heard was ever listed as a spokesmodel on L'oreal's website. I want to say that she was, but I can't say for sure. But I can tell you that she's not there now.

If she was removed, it wasn't done with any flourish or fanfare. It was done quietly days ago.

What do you think? Is she canned from L'oreal or does it mean nothing that she's not on their website (anymore)?

title: The Whole TMZ Video
description:
The entire TMZ video has been released, and it shows the whole story. The amazing @ThatBrianFella - Incredibly Average on YouTube, has posted it for us. Thanks, dude.

In the TMZ version, it's a low-quality video that ends when Johnny snatches up the phone and the screen goes blank. Amber Heard supporters claim that that's when he started to smack her around.

But this version extends beyond that, both at the beginning and the end. In the beginning, it shows Amber Heard turning on the phone to record, and setting it up where he couldn't see it.

The interesting stuff happens at the end, though. After Johnny snatches up the phone and throws it in the trash, he says "Bye." and leaves the room. No slapping her around, nothing of the sort. He leaves.

From there, the video shows Amber fishing the phone out of the trash, gigging and smirking, like she knows she just got one over on him. She then follows Johnny before turning the phone off. Hardly the picture of the poor, embattled victim she wanted the world to think she was.

What I love is that the defense showed the TMZ version of the video repeatedly in London, to try to prove what a monster he is. Then, on the closing day, BOOM! David Sherborne showed the whole video, blowing that pretext clean out of the water. Just like a rock and roll pirate. I only wish I could have seen the look on Heard's face. 

Have a look, and enjoy.

title: Meanwhile in Virginia
description:
While we await the verdict in London, the wheels of justice are still turning in Virginia, where Johnny Depp has sued Amber Heard for defamation.

Johnny Depp’s request for a HIPPA waiver was GRANTED.

Johnny’s request for additional documents was GRANTED.

Amber Heard’s request for additional documents from Johnny was DENIED, in part. 

Hat tip to D @nosanityallowed on Twitter.

I know it seems like January is a long way off, especially considering we haven't heard about London's verdict yet, but day by day, things are moving along in Johnny's case against Amber for defamation.

If I were betting on the outcome, my money would be on Johnny, in both cases. He's long overdue for justice against all the horrors that were done to him, and for her calculated attacks on his reputation. She couldn't own him, couldn't take him for all he's worth, so she tried to destroy him. Didn't work. Not then and not now. 

She's ruined herself, and I couldn't be happier to see it.

title: Zack Snyder's Justice League
description:
just a quick reminder:

We may be getting rid of Amber Heard as Mera in Aquaman 2, but Zack Snyder's Justice League is already in post-production, with Amber Heard as Mera. That's what her IMDB page says, anyway.

I don't know how large or small her role is in the new Justice League movie, but I know that I'm not going to watch it to find out.

This might explain how she's got the money to travel around with world without a care right now. She probably got a chunk of change from Justice League.

Just when you thought your gag reflex could relax...

title: Whitney Heard's as bad as Amber
description:
Whitney Heard has gotten a lot of attention lately with her former boss Jennifer Howell stepping forward with some delightful revelations. More about that soon.

But I thought I’d share this little tidbit with you. It shows that Whitney has the same garbage attitude as her sister, with a mouth to match.

I’m not sure when this is from, but on Twitter, Christina18angie @242sx had the guts to stand up and ask someone who followed Whitney the hard question, saying: “My god! How can you follow a person who helped try to destroy Johnny? This woman and Amber are bad!”

Whitheard answered @cris_angie6, saying: “Ha! You’re suck a fucking idiot. Get a fucking life, you fucking troll! Go back to playing your video games or fucking your cousin or whatever it is you losers do, you ignorant fuck.

Then followed it up with the sentiment: “Troglodytes like @cris_angie6 should go back to the hole they came from.”

You can see the screen shot HERE.

First of all, I may be wrong, here, but is Whit even @-ing the right person? Maybe she knows something I don’t, but that’s not the name I see. Whatever.

As you can see, Whitney Heard isn’t the sweet, innocent little victim of her sister’s abuse. I have no doubt that her sister treats her at least as badly as she did Johnny Depp, but she’s certainly not the sweet little angel.

Whitney’s a grown woman with the world at her feet. She’s got a husband and son at home, yet she chooses to traipse around the world with her sister, perjuring herself to try and clean up her sister’s mess. Shows where her priorities lie.

With an attitude like this, I say the two deserve each other.

title: Johnny orchestrated this petition?
description:
I was surprised and laughed hysterically when Amber Heard's team accused Johnny Depp of orchestrating this petition in recent court testimony in London. Johnny Depp is suing the Sun tabloid for calling him a wife-beater, remember. And Amber's team brought it up. Johnny was forced to answer about it. 

I didn't realize that Johnny or Amber were even aware of our little petition until then. 

I keep seeing articles repeating the same notion, that Johnny Depp colluded with me to start this thing. Another one came out just the other day. I still think it's hysterical, but the ore I see it, the more I wonder. Am I going to have to testify that I alone started this thing? The more she pushes, the more I think I might actually have to.

Not that I mind at all. I started this thing for a specific reason, and I still have a clear conscience about it. I do not believe that a serial abuser should be celebrated in the entertainment industry. I said it on the front page and I still believe it. If I'm called to the stand, that's exactly what I'll say. 

And if they ask me why I write under the name Jeannie Depp, I'll tell them. It has more to do with me than him. (I simply didn't want my ex to see his name on my work anymore, so I chose another name to use, one that I hoped would best serve my work.)

If they want to twist that into something ugly, I can't stop them. All I can do is tell the truth. Unlike the defendant, I haven't done anything that I should be ashamed of.

It would be cool to see Johnny in person, though. So I hope they DO call me for Virginia.

title: Aquaman 2 release date
description:
With a release date of Dec 16th 2022, I think it's safe to assume that filming should start sometime soon. Especially considering the amount of time the movie will need in post to make it look like all those people are underwater. 

So, will Amber be among the cast? Some sources say that WB bought out Amber's contract so that she got paid but won't be in it. (which I believe.) Others say that she's set to reprise her role as Mera. 

There's another thing to consider. Filming will take place in Australia. And if Barnaby Joyce has his way, there might be perjury charges over Pistol and Boo waiting for her there if she returns. 

And there's no statute of limitations in Australia for crimes that involve grievous bodily injury, so she can still face charges over what happened to Johnny's finger. 

Which means that even if Amber's still in Aquaman 2, she runs some serious risks if she shows up to film it. 

What's a girl to do?

title: Perjury over Pistol and Boo
description:
Barnaby Joyce, Johnny Depp’s biggest fan (not) is demanding that Amber Heard be probed over statements she made when she was charged with smuggling the toy Yorkies Pistol and Boo into Australia. There are strict laws about bringing animals into Australia without a quarantine period, and Heard volated them when she brought the dogs into the country on the couple’s private jet. She got out of jail time by agreeing to make a public service announcement about how important the country’s bio-laws are. You can see the cringe-worthy video HERE.

Now, Barnaby Joyce is demanding that Amber Heard be probed for perjury after allegedly telling an assistant to lie about bringing her two dogs illegally into Australia at the time.
Depp's former assistant of eight years, Kevin Murphy, said Heard made him lie under oath when they were accused of bringing in the dogs illegally. Mr Murphy claimed Heard told him: 'I want your help on this. I wouldn't want you to have a problem with your job'. The assistant said he had told the actress several times over the phone, email and in person she was unable to bring the dogs.
Paperwork and the required ten day quarantine period had not been arranged for Pistol and Boo.

Barnaby Joyce is calling the whole thing Dodgy ', saying that Depp and Heard were “just treating the whole thing as a joke. They had no regard for the law as they had no regard for biosecurity laws,' Mr Joyce said. And now he wants Amber Heard to pay for it. He’s got no love lost for Johnny Depp, but it was Amber Heard that smuggled the dogs.

“The Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment is aware of recent media reports concerning the prosecution of Ms Amber Heard in Australia in 2016 and is consulting with the CDPP (Commonwealth Department of Public Prosecution) on this issue,” a spokesperson told Strewth. After a bit of sniffing around, senior sources informed us an investigation was potentially on the cards. The maximum penalty for perjury in Queensland? Fourteen years in jail.

14 years. That’s nothing to play with.

What do you think? Will Amber Heard be tried and convicted in Australia on top of her legal woes with Johnny Depp? Me, I hope so. I hope so a lot.

SOURCE
SOURCE

title: 60 Minutes Australia
description:
60 minutes

 

Barnaby Joyce was Agricultural Minister of Australia when Amber Heard was charged with smuggling Pistol and Boo into the country in October, 2015. He told the dogs to buggar off back to America and threatened to euthanize them.

Well, Barny obviously hasn’t forgotten about Johnny Depp or Amber Heard. He told 60 minutes Australia: “Hey, Johnny, look where your life ended up, old trout! They might be royalty in Hollywood, but we don’t give a toss about that.”

From the beginning, the Aussie documentary seemed heavily slanted toward Amber Heard’s version of events, showing pictures of Johnny sleeping on the floor and sleeping on the couc”h covered in her ice cream, her incessant blathering about how he beat her up and pulled out clumps of her hair.

I watched, waiting for the show to give Johnny equal time, but it didn’t really happen. While the show didn’t try to predict the outcome of Johnny’s libel trial against the Sun, they did say with certainty that everybody involved walks away “stained.”

Me, I disagree. Throughout the course of the trial, with all the evidence being made public every day, there has been an increasing outpouring of support for Johnny Depp, while Amber Heard’s public opinion took a heavy nose dive. People waited outside to give Johnny flowers, while all Amber got was boos. I think Johnny will walk away vindicated, win or lose. The world knows what she did to him, now, and there’s no going back from that.

I’ll give the show some credit, though. While they played Amber’s whining about being abused, they did show pictures of Johnny’s actual injuries, albeit fleetingly, and playing the tape where Amber admits to hitting Johnny repeatedly.

They made repeated use out of that TMZ video, where Johnny was kicking cabinets, as that’s just about the only “evidence” Amber’s team could present that he was ever violent. And I was less than thrilled when it was thrown out there that Johnny might have shat in his own bed and said that he was self-immolating by bringing the libel proceedings.

Ultimately, the show insinuated that both Johnny and Amber are guilty, and that they’re both damaged, no matter who wins.
